meanings.definition: To turn a handle or key to start a machine or engine.
meanings.sent1: She was cranking the old car to start the engine.
meanings.sent2: He cranked the lawnmower to get it running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The kids took turns cranking the toy car to make it zoom across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The DJ was cranking up the volume to get the party started.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she began cranking the generator to power up the lights.

meanings.definition: To move or operate something by turning a handle or key.
meanings.sent1: He was cranking the fishing reel to bring in a big catch.
meanings.sent2: She cranked the window open to let in some fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The old man kept cranking the music box, lost in memories of his youth.
meanings.sent4: The clockmaker carefully cranked the gears into place, ensuring perfect timing.
meanings.sent5: With a steady rhythm, she started cranking the handle to lift the heavy load.

meanings.definition: To start or cause something to start moving or working.
meanings.sent1: The windmill began cranking as the breeze picked up.
meanings.sent2: He cranked the generator to provide power during the outage.
meanings.sent3: The kids were cranking the swing higher and higher, laughing with joy.
meanings.sent4: Her words cranked up the excitement in the room, sparking a lively discussion.
meanings.sent5: With a push and a pull, he managed to crank the stubborn door open.

meanings.definition: To play music loudly and energetically.
meanings.sent1: The band started cranking out their hit songs to the cheering crowd.
meanings.sent2: She cranked up the radio in the car to sing along to her favorite song.
meanings.sent3: The party was in full swing, with the DJ cranking out the tunes all night.
meanings.sent4: The street performer cranked out a lively melody on his accordion.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the festival stage lit up with the band cranking out their final song.
